title: Bond Yields Surge in Europe as Old Jitters Return
sub_head: ECB comments indicating tighter policy ahead have triggered a selloff in European government bonds, especially Italian and Greek debt
body:
Government bond yields surged world-wide after a strong report on the U.S. labor market boosted investorsâ€™ expectations that central banks will begin steadily raising interest rates to fight inflation.
The benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury yield, which helps set borrowing costs on everything from mortgages to corporate loans, settled at 1.930%, its highest close since December 2019. The 10-year German bund climbed to 0.2%, its highest level in nearly three years and further into positive territory after years below zero.
